info.title: Customer management
info.description: API to create, update and manage customer details such as delivery preferences, joint customer details, party relationships, KYC details, alert subscriptions, customer exit status, customer address formats & posting restrictions

get.summary: Retrieves customer details
get.description: Retrieves the customer details such as customer contact information, residence details, legal document details, occupation details and relationship details for the specific customer

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.summary: Create a customer by providing an Id
post.description: Create a customer with the information such as customer contact information, residence details, legal document details, occupation details and relationship details, etc provided by the user. It allows to create a customer with the provided id.

parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: validate_only

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Retrieves list of customer basic details
get.description: Retrieves the customer details such as delivery or postal details, contact information, residence details, customer profile, legal document details, occupation details and status of customer

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: customerName
parameters.description: Indicates the name of the customer. Originator is the party who requests the payment cancellation.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Contains the street name of the customer or the property

parameters.name: addressCity
parameters.description: The town and/or city component of the base address of a customer

parameters.name: countryId
parameters.description: ISO country code of the financial institution.

parameters.name: postCode
parameters.description: Identifies the address postal code for the customer or the property

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: The date of birth of an individual customer

parameters.name: customerStatus
parameters.description: The internal bank status of a customer

parameters.name: sectorId
parameters.description: An institution-defined identifier of the type of customer

parameters.name: accountOfficerId
parameters.description: The identifier of the department head or specific account officer responsible for the customer

parameters.name: industryId
parameters.description: An institution-defined identifier of the industry in which the customer is trading, operating or is associated with

parameters.name: nationalityId
parameters.description: The identifier of the nationality of a customer

parameters.name: residenceId
parameters.description: The identifier of the country of residence of a customer

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: The last name of an individual customer

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone number of the customer or prospect

parameters.name: customerMnemonic
parameters.description: Specifies an alternative easy means of referencing the Customer

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Specifies customer's first name

parameters.name: customerType
parameters.description: Identifies the type of customers. Example Personal, Business, Corporate, etc.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email Identifier of the Customer

parameters.name: mobilePhoneNumber
parameters.description: Represents the phone number of a customer

parameters.name: taxId
parameters.description: Holds the Customer's TAX/SSN Id.

parameters.name: shortName
parameters.description: Contains the name of the account, basically the short title of the account.

parameters.name: officePhoneNumber
parameters.description: The office phone number of the customer

parameters.name: faxId
parameters.description: The fax (facsimile) number of the customer

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Contains the communication address of the customer or full address of the property

parameters.name: relCustomer
parameters.description: Customers linked or related to the arrangement owner

parameters.name: relationshipCode
parameters.description: Relationship identifier between the partyType and relatedPartyType

parameters.name: legalId
parameters.description: Unique reference number of the legal documents submitted as identification proof

parameters.name: legalDocumentName
parameters.description: Name of the legal documents such as passport, driving licence etc., provided as identification proof

parameters.name: birthIncorpDate
parameters.description: Date on which the entity is incorporated

parameters.name: customerNameAdditional
parameters.description: Continuation/Extension to the Customer Name.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves list of customer relationships
get.description: Retrieves customer relationship details such as type of relationship, party information, related as, owning details, role & purpose of relationship for specific party or customer

parameters.name: customerRelationGroupId
parameters.description: Identifies the key to Customer Relationship Group to form a relation

parameters.name: partyId
parameters.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

cardNumber.description: Cards issued are defined with an identifier consisting of three elements. The card type, a full stop and the card number. The card number may be any alphanumeric construction, commonly a 16 numeric number is used. VISA.5332870296579001. The id must be in the form of:  CCCC.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  Where CCCC is the card type and AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a unique identifier.  Examples:   VISA.1234567887654321   GC.1111222233334444   AB21.1111111122222222

currentEndDate.description: Identifies the current end date of the standing order for the currency, amount and frequency specified. When the bank has received from the customer clear instructions which stipulate that the standing order must  only be executed during a determined period of time.  This is the date of the last execution of the standing order or when the customer has requested the bank to pay a certain amount during a determined period of time and then another amount starting from that date. In this case, this field specifies the end date of the first standing order amount.  After that date the second amount will then be executed.
